poem:
Title: "Transmissions Lost and Found"

Through the black and white static of '91,
A voice emerged, stern within a funhouse mirror,
The Black Bag, a stage for the Silenced One.
Now a relic, a VHS glyph heading into obscurity,
Lost in Channel 4's vault, but never in memory,
Whispering truths of multicultural life,
Hiding glimpses of hope amidst strife.
